fJSiyIYnnkT8-B_mRyfc6Q.text: My husband and I got delivery and overall the food was just OK and way overpriced. My husband got shrimp and crab cakes which came with 5 shrimp stuffed with crab for a whopping $30. Definitely not worth it at all. We will not order from here again

EMaEEKOc8DbycFTeZuDMRw.text: Traveling through Charlotte we decided to find a restaurant walking distance from our hotel. The one star is actually designated for our short walk. When we walked in, there were about 10-15 customers in the entire restaurant. We sat at the bar and took several minutes to be greeted. We never received our mussels appetizer. By the time we realized it wasn't coming we also realized our entrees would be an additional 15 minutes on top of the 20 minutes we were already waiting after having ordered.  I ordered the Alaskan king crab. Probably the lamest entree I've ever ordered period. The portion was definitely not the correct size, it wasn't even the correct kind of crab. I was changed an extra $6 for "lobster mashed potatoes" which was pretty much boxed potatoes with a scoop of lobster bisque on top. My boyfriends meal came with the wrong side and the presentation was a literal "what the %!@$" moment, it was so sloppy. Bartenders were not much more attentive to any other customers after we came in, as I noticed food being sent back or incorrect. Long story short, if I knew this was a chain steakhouse I would have went somewhere else.

ESPoQzOLGomc61UhNUqCRQ.text: Went for Queens feast tonight and decided the wife and I would go surf & turf. I ordered what was listed as filet medallion's and the wife ordered the twin lobster tails. What I got was a pre-sliced medallion which was about 3 ounces of meat. The twin lobster tails which we paid an upchare for we're quite small on the portion size as well. Flavor wise the meal was just ok, nothing special to warrant the price.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Charlotte, NC, United States

VHJJPKxOooZ3AXcAseHLFg.text: TRIED to eat here. Walked in for lunch and were seated quickly, however, that was it... literally. We received no attention (not even water!) and no one came to take our order. The restaurant didn't seem too busy or in the midst of a lunch rush so not sure what the reason was. We waited for about 20-30 mins (we were really hungry and kept thinking we would get served), and what took the cake was when another couple of people came in after us and they were seated and got their order taken before us. Not a NC local and don't think I will ever be back here again .. not even when I visit.

Sg06gkl_nvKhcEcMJ27p7w.text: Long wait on a night when half the restaurant was empty. Good bar drinks. Coconut shrimp over priced (4 for $14), but tasty. Ahi tuna tasty but lukewarm. The facility was clean and had a nice feel to it. Overall ok, but for the spend, expectations do not align with the overall experience.

a9ELXEYhgTQFflY2G-2t_Q.text: UPDATE: since my last review, I've gotten food poisoning. It's been pretty miserable these last 2 days, with no end in sight! So unfortunately, I needed to change my review

yQH-Lr22vDCv9qmC2oduzw.text: Birthday party of 5 females: All the ladies new with the exception of me that you can pull up and the will valet your car. I on the other hand parked on the right side of the building in the First Citizens deck which was ok. The waiter and the hostess were very nice and friendly. They both did not mind taking photos of us. Now the food I have to say was exceptionally good. I ordered a salmon rigatoni dish and added 6 jumbo shrimp for 7.00. It had just the right amount of sauce and the flavors were delicious. The salmon was well proportioned to the dish as well. 2 of the ladies had chicken pasta dishes and the birthday girl had some sort of steak dish. There were no complaints at the table on mmm's. The atmosphere was very relaxed but not so much so that people weren't laughing and enjoying there meals. I would recommend this place  for a date night or get together with friends. Side note: It was very cute that the menus had Happy Birthday with her name and they brought out a desert just for her. Will be visiting here again. Happy Eats!!!

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Charlotte, NC, United States

CekJ1S25mNGB_nQNgzA5tw.text: Service was great and there was nothing wrong with our food, but it probably won't be a go-to spot for us. The atmosphere is a little drab in my opinion. It just feels like a chain restaurant. There's no character or charm to it. The food was of good quality but we weren't blown away or anything.  I ordered a steak with mashed potatoes and it arrived on a huge plate that made my meal seem really sad. I was a little disappointed that sides are not included in the price of the meal, but I guess this is common with most steak restaurants. My boyfriend got a pasta dish that he also thought was ok.   I can't bring myself to leave 3 stars because nothing was bad or wrong with our experience, and the service was pretty good!

2E0mSKXbxNKFAhk71C4M4A.text: Pretty disappointed here, on several levels.  To start, there are some 40 or so tables in this place and I came in just before 5 on a Monday and we were the only customers in the place, the next 3 groups that came in were seated right next to us, I mean why did I have to hear every conversation every customer had?  Then we spent about 10 minutes looking at the menu ONLY to be told that was the lunch menu and what we wanted wasnt offered then!  THEN, the food came, OK I'm only too happy to pay top dollar for outstanding food but $20 per crab cake and that was pretty bland with some boring veggies and a steak that was 1 part beef and 4 parts salt, is a great way to keep the customers away.

AVbfry-Dy7tSNJPXg4fjAg.text: I definitely give this restaurant a 1 star. I order steak well potatoes and corn. Remind you paying for my meal is not a problem.  When my food came out I had mixed vegetables and rare meat. The waiter said she would replace the vegetables and then she'll get the manager. The manager says to me do you want me to warm the rare steak up that I asked for well done. Huh hell no!!!!!!! The manager only took off $20 of $200 ticket!!!! Sorry management this definitely needs to be addressed. And then we were told he was a new manager #Sorry

MQtkk6FwCIT3bmHdrDHrgA.text: Alright, the food is amazing.  The service is so bad though! It took nine minutes before anyone greeted our table. It took twenty minutes to get our tea. The drink from the bar was wrong and our server never came back to check on us, so I had to walk it back to the bar myself. The manager (I guess that's who she was) was running around like crazy and we couldn't catch her to get help. Only one glass of water all night -- no refills.

LMQnPVU6zXl78hIjEu7PLw.text: Slow Slow Slow!  Even with a reservation it took over 15 mins to be seated with plenty of tables available in site.  Hostess issues anyone!  After being seated we were totally ignored with wait staff walking by the table for another 15 mins without even water being poured.  We just got up and walked out went to Dandelion Market and had a wonderful quick meal.  This place was a total fail and is off the list.

25pPUAXNF4cgayxP_RefTQ.text: Wondering around uptown looking for a bar seat, quick light lunch and an afternoon glass of vino (shhh) around 2pm. I have eaten at the Schmick's SouthPark, so I swung into the Uptown location. Figured it's reliable and I was hoping for a friendly bartender to chat with.   I really don't get the hype over this place! Everytime I eat there I pretend (to my big Mccormick fan friends) that its great, but honestly, I do not think the service nor the food quality is better than your average Red Lobster.  The "Oversized" prawns, sold by the prawn for $2.50/ea are anything, but oversized and one of mine looked anything, but fresh. The (one, tiny) crab cake I had was tasty, but I have had much much better. It was definitely not "lump" and overpriced ($11 bucks).  Last, the bartender was so consumed in talking to her regular about her own life and barely seemed to have any interest, even when I threw out several safe conversation icebreakers, to talk to her other guests (me and one other guy).   Nonetheless, I still left 20% and thanked them for the "experience", but I think that was definitely the last time I waste $31 ($$$ whoa!) at a Mccormick. I much rather swim over to Bonefish.   Positive note: timely

0R_9d7niqlcPDlSZY7xzCg.text: Average Red Lobsteresque seafood in an upscale atmosphere. What stinks is that when they first opened, I had a fabulous meal and I was excited to have them in CLT. Since then however, nothing but disappointment after disappointment. So sad as there's a dearth of decent seafood in the Queen city and I so thought I had found an oasis after the first visit. Alas... only a mirage......

nHV7R-w18LgiKGFy-w0m9g.text: The server was not very friendly. She seemed annoyed when we asked for more time to look at the menu. And she seemed unhappy when we didn't order any appetizer or alcoholic drink. I got the stuffed salmon and it was okay. It comes with mashed potatoes, carrots and peas. I couldn't really taste the lobster or crab that was supposed to be stuffed in the salmon. The mashed potato was pretty good though. My friend ordered the New York strip and it was delicious even though the price was a little high and it only came with asparagus and half a grilled tomato. The iced water tastes weird. The server did not ask if I'm finished before taking my plate away. The bread was hard on the outside and it wasn't anything special. We came here on a Sunday night and the restaurant was nearly empty. We ordered creme brulee for dessert. The size is surprisingly bigger than we expected. There were mixed berries on top and a mint leaf. The custard was a little soft but overall it was good. The atmosphere of the restaurant is good, with dim lighting and classy plate settings. Overall, we enjoyed our meal but it was not worth the price.

4BrOGBtGUu_wVeZL6H6Fmw.text: Went here for a first date around 9 pm on a Monday. The place was pretty empty as was to be expected at that time. Both of us got filet mignon and lobster tails. We got a side of lobster mashed potatoes and asparagus. Everything was phenomenal. We ate it all and wished we had room for more.

wB4Mch23DVo4GMJmm4Yi1A.text: Spent $120 on dinner and the only thing I enjoyed was the cobb salad for appetizer. The waiter was probably the best I've ever had, so that's a positive. The entree's we ordered were cold, and NOT impressive for the price we paid.  Would not come back here at all.

WOitNAqs3lQmgVw1rUXdsg.text: Right when we sat the water glasses were stained and had to ask to replace the glasses. Boyfriend ordered steak and lobster and asked what sides come with and waitor told It came with asparagus.  When food arrived.. my order was fine but his came with potatoes instead of asparagus . Let it pass and settled for potatoes then realized they were raw. Crunchy ..... and crab cakes we had for appetizer I had better.. never told server but Tipped and left. Wasn't up to hype.

P9jP8Ees83XShX7STQrGsg.text: Three of us went there for Christmas dinner because we were flying back home to Charlotte on Christmas day and didn't have time to cook.  We had reservations and we were seated about on time. They were busy, but not insanely so.    We sat in Steven's section and it should have been an omen that I heard a woman complaining about his service before we sat down.  He took our drink and appetizer order and then disappeared.  He checked in about 10 minutes later as our drink order had "slipped his mind".   We had calamari and mussels which arrived without any appetizer plates or little forks or bowl for empty shells for the mussels.  It was all tasteless...that's the only word to describe it.  No seasoning, no reason to eat it.    We had ordered our meals before the appetizers arrived but the waiter forgot what we ordered and had to come and ask us again.  After about 30 minutes, he checked in again saying "part of the food was up...and what was it we had again?" Oh boy!  Well we got served about 15-20 minutes later so about 45 minutes after we finished appetizers.  I had the mahi-mahi special which at $33 was no bargain.  The portion size was tiny, the fish luke-warm and severely over cooked and burnt on one side. It was so tough I had to take a drink of water to get it down.  Obviously my food had been under the warming lamp long before everyone else's had started.    My husband's sea bass was average and my son's shrimp was pretty good...but, the pacing was so awful the meal was already ruined.  The waiter disappeared again and we finally flagged him down to get our check.  I was looking forward to dessert and coffee but didn't have an extra hour to spare for him to forget it...then bring it...then disappear again.  All in all the meal was very boring, uninspired and served by someone who should never have been allowed on the floor.   He wasn't rude, he just didn't care and didn't seem to know what he was doing.   Won't be going back!

qcMZkmvHGyz2LY6rzCCM0w.text: We went for my cousin's birthday and Charlotte Restaurant Week... The rest of the party was late, so we hit the bar... I loved my Talk of the Town drink and it was on special, so that was fabulous... The bartender Michael was quick and pleasant...  The rest of our service was kind of spotty... Our server was quick with getting drink orders and bringing bread, but took FOREVER to actually bring the check... She took even longer to come back to pick it up and run the card... That part was the worst... The food itself was interesting... We all got the beef medallions, but the results were incredibly varied... They were presliced as well, which wasn't a problem since it let you see the doneness... I ordered mine medium well and some pieces were closer to medium, while the others were a mix of medium well and well done...  The portions were a bit small... I normally never finish a restaurant meal because they're too big and I cleaned my plate... lol  Overall, it was decent, but it could have been better with a more evenly cooked entree and faster table service...

9FH4V4oqYw3aRSFHS1jQbA.text: We chose to Dine at McCormick and Schmick's in Charlotte this past Friday.  We had been to other locations in the States and chose to have dinner here at the last moment following the auto show.  The food was excellenct and the service even better.  If you are looking for seafood, this is the place to go.

SdZHjcdArtImAJApmptYuw.text: This place may not be a great bar-bar at night, but it's definitely a great Happy Hour joint with a good dinner vibe as well.  The Happy Hour specials give some great appetizers and burgers from $2-$8 which is A-OK in my book.  Although the drinks are regular price, the food half off is amazing.  If you really want to have a great time, go on mondays when HH lasts until close (4-7 normally).  This way you can snack and drink for dinner and be satisfied without hurting your wallet.

yAYR9dhFgiDoPUv6r16Zbw.text: Really great for St. Patricks Day!  I'll have to say for a chain, the food was pretty good.  The corned beef sliders were awesome and the mahi mahi was definitely tasty. Although, I wonder where they get that fish from in Charlotte...

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corned Beef sliders &amp; Guinness

XC9Mbyy2SC74jHIb4V_QZw.text: Worst dining experience ever! McDonald's has a more inviting atmosphere. Wait time was awful. We went on Friday night, sat outside for a few until the roaches asked us to go inside. A lot of roaches in the outside dining area. Then it was one thing after the other, food cold and average, staff cold and average. I suggest not spending the money, too much for nothing. Try anything, and it would be much better than this experience. They need restaurant impossible to come and train the wait staff. Horrible experience! Wasted my time and my money.

1oox79BRhaGYcr0OsmMyUw.text: Came here for the happy hour.  Well, actually we came prepared to have a semi-swank dinner but the hosts were like "happy hour, yo!" and we were like "yeah."  Stuff on the menu was as cheap as 1.95 (hummus) and as much as like oh, 7.99 (oysters).  Basically American tapas with a bit of a seafood/tex-mex influence.  The tasty: pesto pizza (although its a bit small), fish tacos, and I'm guessing a sort of Cajun-style shrimp (I haven't been around long enough to really know what that means but it was good).  The less-than-tasty: hummus (too much cumin!), the mussels (well, who thought it was a good idea to put cilantro on mussels? Really!)  Also note that they had some martini/cocktail specials, between 5-7 bucks each - I got a raspberry martini that tasted like a lollipop and didn't give any buzz, so meh.  Yeah I'd come back, maybe not in a hurry but I would.

fsA47FDLlIU9WD5fQN_GPA.text: My family and I dine here at least once a month. We enjoy the service, the wine selection, the specials, the desserts, everything. Perfect location for a small party, and perfect location for a large party. Always a great family night out.

24_mBnujz4LFhuJI6Cl09g.text: This is the other location for McCormick and Schmick's in Charlotte.  The Southpark location is the original and this uptown location was built later.  Doesn't really matter, both locations provide great fresh and some local food choices.  Recently popped in here after work for dinner and had a delicious bowl of shrimp and grits.  Just the right spice and serving size.  The wait staff was great and the atmosphere was quiet and provided a relaxing dinner experience.

8xzmXowGI_jOoJzZ8w83-g.text: Only the appetizer was good. Both of our entrees were practically inedible. I got crab cakes they were so fishy tasting. It was so gross. And it came with French fries. The food is way too overpriced to have French fries as the side rather than a vegetable.

BMQGUimbgE56GbEIOYaLYg.text: My husband defines the service as Chili servers at a fine dining restaurant.  To me it seemed like the whole wait staff was working off Saturday night's party and Sunday morning's hangover. Patrons were crammed in to one section even though the restaurant was fairly empty. Even though the restaurant was empty, the hostess still had trouble finding a table to seat us. I could then overhear servers asking if our table belonged to them. The table that was Seated after us had drinks before we even found our waiter. His name was Thomas, but we didn't learn that until our bill arrived as he didn't find it necessary to introduce himself. Beware of the calamari, it also has pickled vegetables, more than likely you wont be able to determine what you are eating until you bite into it. The chicken fettuccine was good, the stuffed shrimp were small and overcooked but the lump crab meat was yummy. I will not be back... unless it's only to drink wine, they do have good wine selection. It was quite a disappointing meal and definitely not the meal that I wanted to start my honeymoon with.

LTYJdQEswwEi4XUjWSlo1A.text: The Mr. and Mrs. have eaten at the McC & Schm in Bridgewater, NJ, with family.  The Mr. enjoyed his meal at that locale.  The Mrs. does not remember what she ate, but probably nothing memorable or out of the ordinary. Recently when the Mrs. accompanied colleagues to an early lunch at this McC & Schm on South Tryon Street in Charlotte, NC, she was expecting nothing out of the ordinary again. The Mrs. wanted a meal without any fish or meat, but there were no enticing vegetarian offerings.  So she asked the very nice server if she could have the salmon rigatoni ($14) minus the salmon.  The accommodation could be made.  Nice. The bowl of rigatoni contained small pieces of asparagus stalks and mushroom shreds. a tiny bit of artichoke, and a very liquid pesto cream sauce (not very pesto-ey tasting).  No problem.  It was more important to enjoy this lunch with the colleagues. The Mrs. ate only half the bowl of soupy rigatoni, then the nice server boxed up the other half to take back to the office and finish later. The surprise came when the bill arrived.  There was no price reduction for leaving out the salmon from the dish.  It was full price, without the top-billed salmon.  The server informed no accommodation could be made on the price.  The total bill, including tax and very nice tip, came out to $19. Upon returning to the office, the Mrs.' very sensitive stomach was unhappy; perhaps it was the cream sauce.  She threw out the uneaten boxed half of this meal. This lunch of half a bowl of meatless/fishless pasta wound up costing $19.  Way too expensive for an adult-focused fast-food chain-restaurant. The service was nice, the food not so much.  It was the service which earned it the rating. NOTE:  This meal was not on a work expense account. The Mrs. does not think it is worth going back.

n8ywBBQWal7b5fKwXHC9TQ.text: best steakhouse and seafood in downtown charlotte.

XGcMakNdP68kLkaStoxE8A.text: The fish is fresh and delicious, the portions are a good size, and the lunchtime chef, Rigo is a phenomenal talent.  It's about the same price as the Italian place across the street, but in my opinion a much better value.  The wait staff is professional, the happy hour specials (especially the burger) are great.  If I had it in my budget, I'd eat lunch here at least 3 times a week.

lzvph_Spf1NtzQ63y4Onaw.text: I visited McCormick & Schmick's  and it was very nice. The customer service great the food was not bad slightly under seasoned. The portion size for the chicken Parmesan was perfect! The dinning room was clean and the chairs were comfortable. I would go back.

esoedexZSaqEONkHpHVZsA.text: The food, service and atmosphere was exceptional.  I had the Mahi Mahi and it was well prepared, fresh and very tasty.  I have special dietary needs and found them to be very accommodating to my needs and I was able to substitute sides etc..

nMnkx1PV0z8V-fIhIpVTOg.text: Thank you Shawn and staff for helping in celebrating Jason's birthday! Anastasia provided excellent service and the food was delicious as always! Again, thank you! You remain one of my favorite places to dine!

X7Sc5h6DZe2SiNgcrGuNcw.text: Had lunch here while going to Speed Street and the crispy fish tacos were the best I have ever had.  I don't know how they can even get the fish so crispy.  Service was excellent and friendly and nobody minded us wearing t-shirts and sneakers.  Our party also had the grilled salmon, which was cooked perfectly.  They are in the process of a remodel but seemed to have it neatly kept.

yx9R1uuODQ6LZ53V_9CF3g.text: Went to Mc Cormick & Schmick's  on Thursday night with client the service was  good as well as the food. We had a good time.

-A9ESF2ote7UNQ7xdLF7uw.text: OMG- why would a high end place not have an adequate air conditioning system. It was so incredibly hot inside it was not enjoyable. Ridiculous!!  I have no idea how the servers don't pass out.

nk9ivamNk7J68YAsweXVmg.text: usually not a big fan of this chain. Reston, Virginia, location is beat down. DC location is the pits. This location had great service, and the salmon was just how I like it. great meal, but thankfully work expense account as if I dropped $40 of my own $ it would have been too much money for what you get. However, if you want consistent, predictable good food, this location delivers.

A17qD7P3vgT8ftY-oqPU-A.text: Needed last minute (48 hours prior) reservations for Christmas Day.  Phoned SouthPark location first.  Melissa went above and beyond with regard to customer service.  When she did not have availability, she offered to phone the Uptown location.  I was on hold for less than two minutes when she came back with:  a.)  my reservation at my preferred time and b.)  news that the location was handicapped accessible.  I appreciated that service was from the regular menu rather than buffet (an issue for my guest in a wheel chair) and food was good.  One suggestion for improvement would be that, if you see a guest pushing a wheelchair toward the one manual door, might have been nice for someone to offer to hold the door.  The valet did earn major brownie points and a bump in his tip, when he offered to fold the chair and put it in the vehicle for me upon departing.  Valet parking is free but please be sure to tip!  Overall, grateful that a full staff of very professional people had agreed to work on Christmas Day for our benefit.  Will go back.

j1PXAcHX-J9s4HiOy_bnjA.text: After a disappointing experience here the management staff went above and beyond to make sure our next experience was flawless. I can't thank Jennifer and Sean enough for reaching out and putting a personal touch on the visit. The desserts are beyond amazing!

X618-7ZGyPEJqfVmP5-6gw.text: The swordfish with a side of grilled asparagus is to my mouth as Game of Thrones is to a lonely Sunday night.

c7gBgQqnp-MO-7XvflNBCw.text: Fish & chips were fantastic. Plenty of fish - cod, in case you were wondering. Certainly recommended!!!

Oouq5Tawp7AiaCYSagX5EQ.text: Top notch restaurant!  Had dinner her to cap off my birthday in the queen city two weeks ago.  Service was fast, polite, and informative.  Food was delicious.  I had the stuff shrimp.  If you are at South Park Mall, I recommend visiting.  Ask for Quay she's GREAT!

AbusrNjhvfyBJ3Btr4eRzw.text: Fantastic after work spot. The happy hour menu is awesome with lots of different options and are small enough to get several to share. Their martinis are fantastic!

swVzxDu4OvowNVgafQzHwg.text: One word to describe my experience tonight at dinner?  Blah.  Nothing was special about anything I ate there.  I did the restaurant week menu which, for me, included a Caesar salad, stuffed mahi mahi and creme brulee.    The salad was dry and could use more dressing.  Wasn't the worst I've had but really nothing special.  Now the mahi mahi was what I really looked forward to.  Big disappointment.  There was barely any flavor to this dish.  While it was rich (stuffing had creamy consistency), I really thought about adding salt.  Yes, salt, to a seafood dish.    To end the experience, I ordered the Creme Brulee.  Didn't think I could go wrong.  It literally tasted like a snack pack pudding.  It must have been pulled from a fridge and sent to the table.  There was no crunchy, caramelized sugar top.  Honestly, it was pudding with 2 blueberries and 1 raspberry thrown on top.    Service was also disappointing.  We went on a Sunday evening and there were maybe 4 other tables taken in the whole place.  After we finished our dessert we waited and waited for our server.  I actually had to get up and ask another waiter to get her.    Not sure why people love this place.  I wasn't feeling it!

_1yxxgc9TX0857LHkrFdpg.text: The food was excellent and our waiter was not only attentive but friendly and accommodated my fish allergies (I can eat shellfish just not actual fish). Our glasses were never empty and any trash on the table disappeared just as soon as it was created. Our dinner was served in a timely manner and our drinks well made. Everything was exactly the way I remember it from my youth my disappointment was how far it's fallen in manner of class. McCormick and Shmick used to have a dress code and an expectation of elegance. We dressed to go out and found ourselves surrounded by people speaking loudly on their cellphones and in t-shirts. Not only has the standard for their dress code died but so has their desire to create a comfortable atmosphere I felt like I was in a noisy McDonald's with crying children and cellphone conversations as well as cellphone arguments going on all around me. The food is still wonderful but it's not what it used to be.

nHde1onOtnInDn6mIaL4Mg.text: I ate here during a recent visit to Charlotte with a large group of people.  While our service was great, the food was just so-so.  I really don't get the big deal about McCormick & Schmick's.  I'd probably never eat there again.  I ordered the salmon rigatoni and it was OK while eating, but I had bad stomach pains for the rest of the night.

AQ_1m140ZyJcLv8BwlTX7g.text: I love this place and their excellent steaks...

pOjMBbiH7xoK-sVuXXw1IA.text: Eat here often after plays at Belk theater. We enjoy the atmosphere, food and wine.  Good service. Great sour dough bread. The crab tower for appetizer is really good and is a good share.

dcrqjpz2ChjKX9xgjZyaEQ.text: Great place for a lone traveler!  My Bartenders were smart attentive and led me to a great experience!  Completely stuffed with great seafood, I managed to have a slice of the housemade specialty cheesecake!

ZOu0l9lJZHV49dz0Pl7JUA.text: Great food. My husband had salmon and I had wahoo.  I loved the way the fish was cooked.  It was dry how I like it.  I love the butter sauce on the bottom. The roasted vegetables consisted 90% of only onions which I thought was odd.  The asparagus was good too.  The service was terrible.  Our waitress didn't really greet us or tell us any specials.  She didn't bring bread until we asked.  She was super busy though.  I just think they might need more than one server outside.  We will definitely go back,we just hope we have a better experience.

kxZnFQF7-b4mREO16asJ3Q.text: Great food, but what I really enjoy is the great happy hour food specials at the bar - you can also sit outside on Tryon if the weather is good - awesome deal and food is great! Get a few drinks and you got a great meal and deal!

0H0qQ69MWzkw4sP4ggrt9Q.text: My other and I have yet to eat here but this is one of our favorite spots to stop for a cocktail or two prior to seeing a show. Service is always great and the drinks are always delicious.

su1cKFPidaSEL9N3Q3ZJLg.text: The restaurant is surprisingly empty on a Sunday around noon. For brunch, they have $3 mimosa, which is a great deal. The food is decent, but not anything too special. The outside seating is great for people watching. Overall a good experience.

CF_07gC0j9OUjBJPHL4SIw.text: We all had different dishes, food was mediocre at best. Overpriced portions are small and tasteless.  A definite never again.

B5n68XZuOSH_JtNi2057VA.text: Walked into this place and immediately noticed the 94% restaurant score. Had my husband not been so impatiently hungry, we would have gone somewhere else.  So we stayed.  The service was satisfactory when the waiter finally came over to the table.  Our appetizers were luke warm... it took way too long for them to come out. I felt like they sat in the back for at l way 20 minutes. (That's how warm the shrimp was). Either it sat there or the coconut shrimp was frozen and unthawed.   I ordered the NY Strip. It was great. Cooked to perfection.   We also ordered the pecan apple pie with ice cream for dessert (pictured here). That was pretty good.   I won't necessarily look for this place when I come back. Your experience may be different. Enjoy...maybe?

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pecan apple pie

7B-2vXzreU8ycEhSFlJilw.text: They hubby and I come here for dinner often and the food is always so delectable.  We often make reservations via OpenTable as some of the times are 1000 point tables! We're always greeted warmly and the waitstaff is always attentive and pleasant.  Sidney or Sydney- I'm not sure how she spells it, is such a great waitress and accommodating with suggestions for dinner or dessert and she's been correct each time.    They have a variety of seafood dishes (the crab stuffed shrimp are my fave) from fish, shellfish, to pasta and mouth-watering steaks (the hubby often opts for the ribeye).  During the last visit, the hubby had the crab & shrimp stuffed Salmon and I had the Filet Mignon w/crab stuffed shrimp.  I was born and raised by the beach and the seafood tastes pretty fresh and the steaks are always cooked to perfection.  This place will continue to be our go-to restaurant for date night.

IsA9t0Gdmb3Q6nEtJOxaPw.text: Well that didn't go well at all. Should have checked the reviews to this location before we went in With so many other options around. The service was awful. I worked for Landry's company for many years and this location is suffering. The server went over nothing. We ordered a bottle of wine, she didn't know the bottle (which is fine) but then questioned us in the price which is not ok. Guess we looked like we couldn't afford it. Then she didn't know how to open it. Manager came tia deist and still spilled some. Appetizers came out with the meal.  Food was ok. Great location. Lots of space. Food and service, not up to par.

4rHlnrlr_-oEtdZwPV183w.text: Probably won't be back. The salad was the best part.  It was only ok all around.  Bread- was sour dough w/ whipped butter. Good if that's your cup of tea. I liked it, but sour dough's not my favorite.   Vodka soda- great! They also have Ciroc.   Amazing salad!!! Ranch was the best. The croutons tasted smoky. Cesar dressing was not great.  Rigatoni in white sauce - ok, but nothing fantastic.   Mashed Potatoes- ok, but not the best.   Tuna was miniscule, smallest plate ever for $29. Crazy! My friend liked it, but not worth the price. She left hungry.

RgWKs4wNXQS4hglEkgbCLg.text: In Uptown for a business trip.  A group of us stopped in McCormick & Schmick's looking to get dinner.  We didn't have reservations but they did get us a table after ~ 15 minute wait.  Hostess was very accommodating.   Place was jammed for the Tuesday night.  Bar section had no seating available.  There was a section between the bar and dining area that appeared to be hosting a private event.    I would call this semi upscale dining.  Menu mainly consists of seafood options.  Entree prices are in the mid $20s and up.  I got the Beef Medallion Bordelaise with a side of mushrooms and spinach.  $27 entree.    Drink selection was good, but expensive, especially the cocktails.  The Ancho Chili Margarita was a disappointment.    The food was good.  I felt the portions were small.  In fact, I left hungry and had to grab a flatbread from my hotel's restaurant.    I doubt I will come back.  Uptown has too many options that are better.  I seriously doubt they will miss my business though based on the number of customers they had on a Tuesday night.

6eylwTRP0ycndwGEyZ17Wg.text: Ate there with my son and we both ordered the fillet mignon.  My sons was fine but my fillet did not look like a fillet at all it was shaped like the state of Florida and look like it had been run over by a Ford truck.  I also ordered the garlic potatoes which were dry and starchy.  The manager came over and offered to have them cook me something else but by that time my son was finished with his meal so I declined, they made no other offer of reparation, Not even to comp a drink

9ibVM_AhR0KbC_6Y63JqSA.text: Ordered through Grubhub, very specific ordering instructions to NOT have mushrooms on my burger (allergic), food showed up incorrect.  Contacted Grubhub who in turn tried to contact the restaurant (M&S was not answering phones).  Understand the fact that a third party is involved, but the order and the confirmation was very specific on the prep of a $17 dollar burger and was left holding the bag.  Not again.

8m03L7On4z7bt0r41erruA.text: Had the Mahi Mahi for main course and mussels for starter.  Excellent.  In fact it was so good I came back for the same the next day.   Service was great and both times the waiter and waitress attended to my food allergies which are complicated.

hlAVDfxbMeR6vFiUna4gwg.text: We had the worst service today at one of my favorite restaurants. Rachel, our server was awful, she bought the wrong drinks and food to our table twice. We had to keep flagging her down, never came back to check on us after bringing us the incorrect orders. I'll be going to another location from now on

z_5ZLfVWUonm-0LgNv5PXA.text: I was very disappointed in my food because I received a(n) order with peppers, and sauce that was burnt, watery, bland, and downright disgusting. I had to get a side of sauce to try and cover up the gross-factor, and picked all the peppers out myself. Unfortunately we didn't get bread so I ate nothing. I received one refill and sat thirsty for the last 20 minutes of my 'meal'. The meal came with two vegetables and was asked if youd like a salad-- Thinking the salad was substituted for a 'vegetable' and not an 11$ add on--the answer was yes--then was very disappointing to find this out UPON receiving our check. Darryl then takes my plate--unbeknownst to me--goes to the back, and places it in a to-go container. I don't like my food touched, mishandled, or ill-prepared, and I suffered from all of the above. Needless to say I will not be returning, taking my mom, or any other loved one to this place for that matter!  It's several OTHER steak houses on tryon Rd in Charlotte NC--GO THERE!  BAD SERVICE BAD FOOD

rpY9VG1vHQMhamQp2wsmnQ.text: Had reservations last night at the uptown location to celebrate a friend's birthday.  When we arrived, they told us that our reservations were at the South Park location (wrong).  They most likely said that because they didn't have our table ready until about 25 min later.  Anyway food was great but service for some reason was extremely slow.  When our food finally came out, some of the dishes were cold and had to be sent back.  They finally got it right after a while, but service was off last night.

L4nKhaW213waOZAypQ2SWg.text: Huge disappointment during restaurant week. We made reservations in advance yet we're still seated late and didn't receive our APPETIZERS until we were here for an hour.   The presentation of the food was probably one of the worst that I've seen in a long time.   Complimentary bread? No. Didn't happen. We asked another waitress whether this was normal, and she answered simply: "You're supposed to receive complimentary bread." Ha!   It's been 1.5 hours thus far... still haven't received our meal. It's 11:05, the restaurant is technically closed.   The couple behind us? Yes, they have received their bread, appetizer, and main course. Nice!   Update: the sweet server, whom unfortunately wasn't our personal waitress, Stephanie, who told us about the complimentary bread (that we received 2 hours in) really tried! I appreciate her efforts.   .. on a positive note, our requested 2 hour bread was good & the entree was decent. I will never return to this location.

_KG72AzvfafxS_FKQX2uTA.text: Have had good experiences in the past so when my brother brought his family in for Thanksgiving, I thought this would be a good choice.  Boy was I wrong.  The Thanskgiving meal would have been better at a cafeteria.  The service was lousy, but not due the the wait staff.  There were too few people working to serve the substandard meals.  I was totally embarrased by my recommendation.  Especially when I saw what my brother had to pay for a horrible meal.

-QIt1ncAbKvstSCkBJht9g.text: This is a very nice downtown location, which was recommended to us by our business associates after a meeting.  I give a good, solid recommendation for this place.  The food was good, tea was good, service was good - I have no complaints at all.  Hubby had shrimp and grits, and I had a salad topped with salmon.  Hubby absolutely wiped his plate clean, and I did a pretty good job myself!  The decor is upscale; this would be an excellent choice for a business lunch.

RekoiqhoKv67iz_jOA3ORA.text: hhhhmmm!!!stuffed shrimp, grilled shrimp, seared scallops, grilled salmon, lobster mashed potatoes, broccoli & carrots... after sitting in rush hour traffic while raining this meal #FAILED my expectations!!! I've had better fish & crumbs from long john silvers & captain Ds!!!apparently they could see my disappointment & offered a FREE dessert... the hostess, server & manager were SUPER nice & deserve a raise!!! #foodPORN #noFOODgasm #teamSEAFOOD #blessedANDhighlyFAVORED #favorAINTfair #overCOOKEDshrimp #crispySALMON #queenCITY #landrysINC #mccormickANDschmicksNC #bringBACKoriginalRECIPE #whatHAPPENED2stuffedLOBSTER

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Charlotte, NC, United States. ultimate mixed grill :( :( :(

yL0kRyp8qwHS2sQz0EJEdQ.text: I dined here yesterday because it was one of the many restaurants participating in "Charlotte Restaurant Week". For 30 dollars, a person can get an appetizer, main course and dessert. My waitress was excellent and helpful. Food was great and the wait wasn't too long. A good place to go for a date if you're feel like splurging.

zMfbOEyDNQ02wKuHHJzntA.text: Food is okay. Service is lacking. Somewhat overpriced for quality of food. For a few more dollars can have much better quality of food and service.

2Scl0skmcJE-LTgwaFWIAw.text: Loved it!! They have Valet parking, too. We didnt realize that till we parked. Ok, The place is very pretty, almost old school glamorous, almost! We were seated in a booth and our waitress  Parrish, I believe greeted us immediately and took our drink order. Frank didnt want apps, but I always do. So, I ordered the Arugula Strawberry Salad that had radishes, candied slivered almonds with a Honey Lemon Vinaigrette, delicious. They used baby Arugula and its strawberry Season, so they were sweet and delicious and played off nicely with my peppery arugula. I then ordered The Stuffed Shrimp with Crab meat with a Red Pepper White Cheddar Mash and Mixed Vegetables. I swapped out the mixed for some Sauteed Spinach, like I've never had. Im so mad I didn't ask how it was made. It was simply made but had such flavor, I guessing there was garlic, shallots, and wine in it, not sure.  Anyway, my shrimp were nicely stuffed with sweet crab and they were drizzled with a lemon butter sauce, I believe. I was very happy with my dish.  Frank Had the Palm Beach Mahi Grilled with Crab Potato Hash and a sweet Corn Bisque, although I dont remember the bisque, now that I think of it. Hmmmm......   Any, his fish was fresh and delicious and it sat atop the Crab potato hash, so good. We had the Walnut Apple Crumble with Cinnamon ice cream and split it. Enough for two. That was the perfect ending to this perfect meal. I'd definite;y go again. I dont know why they dont have more stars. I think you're nuts if you dont enjoy this place.Im a complainer, trust me and I was happy from start to finish her.  Btw, as I left, I saw someone's plate with the Halibut on top of rep pepper Risotto, OMG it looked so good, I wanted to go back in and eat again.  Ill be back, tho and I'm getting the Halibut.

rYVQPlOCVFpvDa3zu8gqcA.text: Went here for a group dinner. They have a happy hour menu on the patio and in the bar. The happy hour menu has very attractive prices. The set of drink on the happy hour menu is limited. The regular menu has a great selection of seafood and meats. The seafood dishes are great. We had a mixture of happy hour and regular dishes. The food is ok but not fantastic. The service was unattentive and slow. This was a slow Monday night, so I was surprised that service was so slow. There are numerous dining choices nearby there is no need to settle for un-attentive service and medium quality food.

sQzf43Q1-TP_TxOEpTBH4Q.text: We are in here town for a week and this place was on the list of the recommended restaurants by our local office.   The atmosphere was great.  We sat outside on the patio and enjoyed the weather.  We each ordered the Ultimate mixed grill. The price was a little high but we liked what we saw on the menu.  The food was great however I thought there was going to be more food so I was slightly disappointed with the portion.  The service was alright.  As our server approached us, she said hello then started to tell her coworker what to do with the table that just left.  So the first impression was obviously not great. Anyway the overall experience was good.  The food came out correctly and in a timely manner.

0p_FIprbWo_xW2opXZwRuw.text: Idk don't even know where to start. It was just awful! Save your money and go to Chima's or Ruth Chris. Had reservations for 10pm for me and my fiance to celebrate. Stuck us in the back corner and leave us sitting there for 25mins to be exact.I literally had to get up go find the General manager Sean myself. He immediately started to give me excuses rather than a apology. Sent a out a free appetizer and that was it. What made it even worst is that by the time we got our food it was 10:50pm, which my order still didn't come out correct.  Completely unaware that they close at 11pm. Once 11pm struck they turned on all the lights in the restaurant (it's usually dimmed to set the mood). I get it but I feel like they shouldn't take reservations that close to closing time if they are going to be handled that way. I've never had such a bad experience. And the manager never came back by at the end of the meal to make sure we were satisfied. Safe to say I'll never go back !!!!

ugp2v1nKoEsogjS0YfWNbg.text: One of the best places I've eaten at in Charlotte. We went for Restaurant week and to celebrate my eldest daughter's birthday, the put happy birthday on my daughters menu.  the host Sean was great, knowledgeable, friendly and courteous My daughter had the beef medallions which she loved, My wife had a steak and it was very good and I had the Ahi Tuna that was good but could have been seasoned a little better. .  We had a "Blue Crab Dip" starter, that I could not get out of my head! I liked it so much I had to get some ingredients to try to recreate it. close but no cigar.Got to go back again. the creme brulee was so delicious but not enough of it for me.We will be coming back again and again and again.  Go get get some!

ZEoVrb8Di6V4PhkhCv4xCA.text: Usually I love this restaurant, however after eating crab cakes I was very sick and it ruined my evening. Not going back

BOGdBDQQY4R9UEIBZ7YwUA.text: GET the SHRIMP kisses. Amazing. Be sure Matt is your server. He's amazing.

Fg8mDz35YBcVgbFsFeaH0A.text: The service at the Tryon St location was amazing. The manager Sean Williamson and the bar tenders "Brant" and "Craft" made it an evening to remember and treated us so well. Of course the food was great too!

B61EnGDmvK5zpUlgfNI47Q.text: I usually love raving about good places to eat uptown, but this isn't one of those. I tried this place twice. Once for lunch and once over Christmas for dinner. Both times the food was cold and overpriced. Our waitress was having a hard time getting our order in and our drinks out due to the crowd. I swear the place over booked. It wasn't her fault. I think going forward, unless it's half price apps at happy hour, I'll be headed somewhere better.

oT4WKkZ37z50AkNgxacQmQ.text: Last Sunday, my in-laws, wife and I had another great dinner experience at McCormick & Schmick's!  We were promptly seated by our hostess and our waitress soon followed. She took our drink orders and told us what the daily specials were.  Our orders consisted of bourbon glazed salmon with green beans and white cheddar mashed potatoes, fried oysters with chesapeake fries & cole slaw and Idaho rainbow trout with grilled asparagus and white cheddar mashed potatoes. The meals arrived quickly and served piping hot. However, the rainbow trout did not taste fresh and our waitress immediately apologize and offered the menu to make another selection. Buttermilk fried shrimp with chesapeake fries & cole slaw was the selected replacement. It also arrived quickly and served piping hot. The manager came to our table and she apologize for the taste of the trout and offered desserts on the house. We all declined and thanked her and the waitress for their great customer service.  Again, our waitress was excellent and the food was great!

PcBghydCQ1qK4_6zjsCBhA.text: Good Happy hour for the food ok happy hour for the drinks. I got a burger it was really big so i cut it in four to make them sliders. The burger was prob one of the best i have had yet in charlotte. Also got some muscles those were also good and fresh. The salad needs some work though.  I got a cezer plain the lettuce was fresh but not super fresh. The dressing was a biz water down. They need to work on the quality of the dressing. The out door seating is nice and big. Great for people watching on the weekends. Lots of foot traffic. The inside was really big. clean with valet.

zC5g5NrbDq3bPYQB-NjERQ.text: Totally disappointed in the service and food.  Arrived there on Friday night for "bar food".  Our waitress did not even have a clue what was on that menu nor did she know what wine was poured by the glass.  She misinformed us that a certain wine was available by the glass only to return and state it was only available by the bottle.  To make matters worse, the wine we wanted to order (we are aware of the retail price) was almost 4 times what you would pay retail.  That is too much of a mark-up for any restaurant!  We had to hunt her down for our checks and even then she did not get the correct items on the correct checks.    The corned beef sliders came with one small slice of corned beef on a bun which overpowered the meat.  Thankfully, you got three sliders per order so you could move the corned beef from the remaining two sliders to produce a slider that was edible.  Too many other places in Uptown to spend money for palatable food and knowledgeable wait staff.

c0OuA83HRncehUVSlDETEw.text: Just went to happy hr today and got a new waitress she gave the worst service and when I complained to the manager he sided with her without even offering an apology with so many places uptown to enjoy happy hr,i will never go there again

7VYZm1kJ4AF7Fh3SzFx5qQ.text: I overcame my corporate prejudice to meet with friends over the holidays, and I have to say, not too shabby.  We were shopping (i.e. broke), so we came for happy hour's $1.95 menu. I wasn't expecting much from a two-dollar fish taco, but they give it up: it's about 6 inches, weighty with tilapia and a nice slaw, and a delicious tangy dressing. My homegirl got potato thingies (sorry), which were really good, and our group got the hummus too.  Of course all this cheap goodness came with a drink minimum, but ahem, that wasn't going to be a problem, and I was impressed with the mojitos. If you're gonna support the corporate beast, you could do worse than a drink, a couple treats and a $10 tab.

8BFXSWF_QsX5CW4HXT5C8g.text: Had great service but the food was below par. Oysters were not cut off the shell and had to basically tear the oysters apart to get to them. There were 4 of us all together and none of us were satisfied.

R0ktNduRbHRsLPn_Y8Em4w.text: I managed to snag a 6:30 reservation at McCormick and Schmick's using OpenTable last Saturday night even though it was packed. When we arrived, we found the hostess pretty much turning away anyone without a reservation.  The hostess offered to let us sit faster in the bar area at a table, or we could wait for 15 minutes for a table outside the bar area. We opted for the bar table. For some reason, after we were sat, I received an email from OpenTable notifying me that my reservation had been "cancelled" by the restaurant, which was annoying because you get points for making and keeping reservations via OpenTable, which can later be redeemed for gift certificates. Because they cancelled my reservation, I didn't accrue those points.  That issue aside, our server was Susan, and she was fast and helpful. The food came out quickly, as expected since they had a fairly set Restaurant Week menu. My crab cakes were excellent, but my husband reported that his scallops were cold.  The service (and my crab cakes) are what jack this review up to 3 stars. They got it about half right. I can't say that I'd definitely return.

PC8R-VFMjD90v1AdxSEN_w.text: I've been at my table for 1:45 minutes  and have only gotten soup and stale bread. Longest wait in a beautiful, well known restaurant. Good quality aside, not worth the wait.

vUUyvixXLfEmSOMpnZ7QsA.text: I was here for a networking event in their private room in the back. They set up a few chafing tables with some canapes that were quite good. Shrimp in a sweet barbecue sauce. Kobe beef burgers. Crab cakes. Cheesecakes and other sweet desserts.  Several wait staff working the room taking and filling drink orders, clearing dirty plates and ensuring that our needs were met.  More plates and more cutlery would have been helpful. There was still food remaining when we ran out of ways to carry.  Otherwise, a pleasant evening.  [Review 11157 overall, 931 of 2019.]

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Charlotte, NC, United States. McCormick &amp; Schmick’s Seafood &amp; Steaks, Uptown Charlotte NC

UhZBF4r584obCdfHTjxKrw.text: Dropped in for a late dinner one evening and decided to sit on the front patio to people watch since the weather was nice. The waitress was friendly and attentive to our drinks.   Maybe I was really hungry, but it seems like it took a while to receive our food, considering there weren't many other guests at the time.   Everything was pretty good. A little overpriced in my opinion for the small portion sizes.

CN8ZLgEO05jK5qTHxsR3lA.text: We had lunch there on August 18th. The restaurant wasn't busy - maybe a third full. The waitress was prompt to begin with, but it was down hill after that. I ordered fish and chips. The fries were soggy and the presentation left a lot to be desired starting with the grease slick at the bottom of the plate. The slaw was bland tasting mostly of ground cabbage with a very light mayo dressing. The fish was fine. The bread in a basket was thrown on the table at the end of the meal instead of at the beginning of the meal with no word from the waitress. Refills were placed on the table at the end of the meal when we were ready to leave - again not a word from the waitress. On top of everything, she overcharged us for an appetizer that we didn't have. So much for hoping to have a nice lunch. I've eaten at this chain before so I'll chalk it up to a bad day in the kitchen and on the floor.

eCWFKMVZbWBNyOdgG5FPog.text: Came here for my birthday. The food was immaculate for me and my guest. The bullet drink was weak to me and I asked for the strongest drink by waiter which was a super sketchy dude hindsight. The lobster mash & crab cake was the MVP's for the dish. They had a personalized menu with my name and age turning on it. It was a really great touch that I enjoyed. I will for SURE!! Say make sure to keep your receipt. Things happen and cover yourself. Management team is amazing at the restaurant.

Would definitely recommend this place , also had the chicken lettuce wrap, very tasty but could have used more lettuce for the wrap part.

wwlx3B_y7Z1wu4ITTs2FNw.text: Came here for lunch with a friend and honestly it was just okay. In the past I've been here for dinner a couple of times, but that was years ago.   Lunch time wasn't that crowded which is why I was surprised that service was slow. We probably waited five minutes for someone to come and take a drink order. Our server was friendly, we just felt like it was slow. We did get some bread but that took a while to come out as well.   I was also surprised that there weren't any great lunch specials so  expect to still spend some money here. For meal I ordered a chopped salad with salmon. It was nothing special. To me, the salad was over dressed making the lettuce wilted. There were some bits of blue cheese but that was the most exciting part. The salmon was okay. A little dry and seasoned okay. I've just had better. For a place known for seafood, I was just expecting more.   It's definitely a place to take it slow. I've heard great things about happy hour. Maybe I just caught them on an off day.

W4lyEVDn2WePW9ixQhtZHQ.text: I love that they have happy hour food specials on Saturday. I went around 640pm on a Saturday. It wasn't busy. Service was fast and my server was friendly. I ordered the burger, buffalo shrimp, chicken lettuce wraps, and calamari. For my drink, I ordered an all American without coke. I liked everything except the lettuce wraps. The chicken was drier/tougher than I was expecting and did not make for a good lettuce wrap. I'd definitely recommend for a happy hour outing. They have a lot of good food options and you can get a good amount of food without spending a lot of money.

qN_b6yrb9kd47g-1e-KmBA.text: Went for restaurant week and was impressed with the three corse meal. Every dish that came out was amazing. The first dish was the tomato caprese danished with fresh basil. The main course was a crap and shrimp stuffed salmon. The dish featured mashed potatoes and fresh green beans. The salmon was cooked perfectly and it was a great proportion. The desert to sum it all up was their peanut butter pie. The pie doesn't even need to be explained... it was superb! The only thing I could change was this particular restaurant wasn't quite prepared for restaurant week. The waiter was so sweet and attentive, but he had too many tables. Some things we requested came later than sooner.

YdxytseV5uuzVNfAHCC-ew.text: So while traveling to Charlotte, I decided to visit M&S because I was in the mood for some seafood. No reservation but me and my buddy were seated immediately. As expected, good atmosphere and clean restaurant. Wait staff greeted us immediately and took our drink order. So had the lobster bisque which was fantastic. The crab cake entree was underwhelming and the apple pie was pretty good. What wasn't good was the service. Waitress never offered to refill my water and she botched up the check. First she offered to split the check for me and my buddy, took our cards, but she charged my card for his bill and vice versa and she never gave us the itemized bill. After running the cards she disappeared so we had to track down the manager to verify the bill being incorrect and then rerun the cards. Then after the second manager corrected the mistake, she returns finally to say "my shift is ending, can I have the checks to close out" REALLY??? Oh and she said "it was a pleasure to serve you today" No it wasn't as it showed in your lack there of. Disappointing because I love M&S. After having to call the manager over twice and then having to wait an additional 20minutes just to get the bill straight and to have nothing even offered for the inconvenience is textbook poor customer service.

QKDJa-YOVkdgU9RPsLUq-w.text: Not sure where to start on this "fine dining" review. I was in town with some friends for the bar crawl & found myself craving a juicy ribeye. For starters, a gentlemen (Brandon) cleared our table & when we started making requests, he said he was a former employee and just helping out. Turns out, he may have just been the most helpful "employee" of the evening. Our waitress, Emma, brought our bread with no plates and took quite some time to bring out 3 - we were actually a party of 4. I should also add there were no utensils on our table, so after waiting too long for her to return, I opted to grab some from an unoccupied table. I took a sip of my water and noticed a lip print on my glass - not mine because I used a straw. Sigh!!! When my meal finally arrived, I had the vegetable of the day on my plate as a side instead of the mashed potatoes I ordered. I also asked for my Caesar salad to come out first - it came out with my entree. Thank goodness for the bread, or else I would've starved!  The ribeye I longed for was dripping with red instead of the medium well I requested. I ate it anyway because my goal was to end this disaster of a meal as fast as possible. When our waitress made another appearance  (we had to make our requests through wait staff walking by to serve other tables) I called her Taylor - not sure where I got that name from, to which she says "It's Emily by the way." Perhaps I would've remembered that had I seen her more than once the entire evening!! To sum up a very long and scathing review, we left World of Beer & walked here b/c they were out of ribeyes. I thought this was the end of an unfortunate dining experience. I was wrong. M&S, you're not just a restaurant, but a brand, and I could not be more disappointed in my experience here. DO BETTER!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Clean&#34; glass I drank from...

tQ8qJJYgu8hsqTlnWk0tJg.text: First time in Charlotte, NC, just arrived in town and was starving.  Remembered McCormick & Schmick's as a very nice restaurant from when I was growing up so I walked over for a small bite at the bar.  First thing I noticed was that there was a man passed out in his chair at the bar.  Nobody seemed bothered or cared.  I ordered the jumbo chilled shrimp cocktail off the happy hour menu and when it arrived it had not been deveined.  I looked on the internet and confirmed what I was seeing was in fact what I thought it was - the shrimp's intestinal remains.  I was really surprised that a place like McCormick & Schmick's would serve its customers with such low quality care.  The whole thing turned me off.  If you want to have a nice meal or sit at a nice bar, there appears to be no shortage in the area.  Eddie Vs, Ruth's Chris, BLT Steak, and I'm sure many others I just don't know are within eyesight.  Spend your time and money at a place that prepares and serves its food with pride.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jumbo shrimp cocktail was not properly deveined - really not what one would expect for a &#39;nice&#39; restaurant

hunHh0EEAB8cAlt7twz3oA.text: The food was great.  I just dislike the pork in the clam chowder . But I love sitting outside facing Tryon.  Service is always great. They aim to please. The only thing was we seat ourself for outdoors and the seats and tables had not been cleaned off so I had to do it.

XVM0v4wltvVlmRZg1lvyQA.text: Happy Hour! OK, that's the only time I have ever patronized this place, although we have had some office lunches at the South Park location.  M&S has some amazing happy hour specials that are available in the bar area and on the patio (which is currently under construction). Note that the bar area includes several tables that can serve 2-4 people. The specials are available from 4-7, and some are even available until close. We stopped here before seeing Hamilton and got in at about 5:30. It got pretty crowded by 6:00 (there was also a Hornets game that evening).   I ordered my usual $5 cheeseburger which is probably the best deal in town. I mean, think about it, a fast food burger costs about $5 without a side but at M&S you get a small order of steak fries with it! The caveat for the happy hour deals is you have to purchase at least a $3.40 drink, but that's easy enough with a beer, soda, or cocktail.  The bartenders and the bar area staff have always been on point. While I don't always like to share "best-kept secrets", this is one worth sharing. If you can get here at 5 after work or before an event, then the happy hour is in amazing deal.

Zy9HsFLJM1Y7M6KQdVBJLw.text: I enjoy the occasional business lunch at this restaurant. During a recent lunch here, I ordered a salad and it was large and tasty. My colleague also had a salad and it looked yummy as well.  Service was slow, and the dining area feels a bit stuffy and dated. Also, odd thing to point out, but the booths are INCREDIBLY uncomfortable. Something about the backs of the booth being too upright I believe.   This is a good place for a professional business lunch, but I'd go elsewhere if you are looking for a quick and casual bite to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Charlotte, NC, United States

rqqY4YdwyaO67EZ34gNMkA.text: Came here for happy hour with a few good ppl. After multiple terrible experiences at the South Park location, I was sure I wouldn't be to this establishment again. Well, it was on the list of happy hour spots and I hadn't been to this location, so why not?  It was all good at first. We got there early and was able to get a table in the bar area. Our waiter came by in decent time and we ordered a round of drinks and food from the happy hour menu. I ordered a margarita and the fish tacos (2 per order). Margarita was good. I got through one of my fish tacos and was SURE I would be back for more because it really was that good, especially with the corn salsa.  Now I get to my 2nd taco and after one bite...there it was...a long string of black hair . Gross!  I told the waiter he apologized and offered another order of the tacos, I respectfully declined. But since I was still hungry, I ordered the coconut shrimp. Something I can see without any additional ingredients and definitely not wrapped up.  The shrimp came out fresh & hot, and it was also good. However, 4 shrimp for $9. Anyway, the waiter also brought out ONE taco, to compensate for the taco that had hair in it (even though I declined). He said we can have it, since it was made. I gave it to my friend, with no hair this time.  Time for checks and the tacos are still on my check. Come on guys. Even if I wanted the other ONE taco, that was a gross mistake. Where has this persons hair been? What has it been in? And what's been in it?? You could've taken it off the bill without me having to ask.  So once I requested the removal of the tacos from the bill, they granted my request, I paid and we were on our way.  1.5 stars - margaritas, the one taco w/o hair and the waiter was pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish tacos, would&#39;ve been great, if there wasn&#39;t hair in it.

_9CNj_4J7CENNjMlUQNtwQ.text: A customer representative reached out on 11/01/18 and asked for my contact information and stated someone would contact me, as of today 07/08/19 no one has contacted me. This is a restaurant that considers themselves 5 stars and pride themselves on customer, but clearly can't even provide decent customer service inside the restaurant and at the corporate level. I strongly suggest not going to this restaurant. They have become a restaurant that just chooses to thrive based off their name and obviously don't care about the customer.

Uut64kTgd945VD6nL3x9fQ.text: I came here with coworkers last night for a team dinner. I know it's a chain which isn't always ideal but it offered something for everyone. We started with cocktails at the bar - I ordered and old fashioned against my better judgment and as soon as I saw it I regretted my order. It was huge. And if you know anything about old fashioneds, you know that's not a good sign. It looked so watery, and tasted probably worse than it looked.  Once seated for dinner we got the tuna tartare to start. They served it decomposed which was thoughtful if anyone at our table had dietary limitations, but we didn't specify that we did so it was kind of awkward to mix in the mustard, capers and onions into chopped raw fish.  We all ordered steaks and they were fine but nothing remarkable. The biggest offense was the veggies the steaks were served with. They had rainbow carrots as part of the veggie medley and they looked good, but were so al dente it was comical. We joked they were harder than if you had just pulled them out of the ground. Almost impossible to cut even with a steak knife.  Service was very friendly and attentive, but they didn't clear any plates or empty cocktail glasses from the table throughout the whole meal.

jzLeT5YJcQGE9dS13XaoUA.text: Seafood Excellence!!!! Went here for my birthday and the attention to detail from the time I valeted my car till I sat down at my table. The menu had my name on it and the waiter was personable and treated me as if I was the king of Great Britain!  I raw oysters that were fresh and delicious. For my main course I had stuffed shrimp which I highly recommend. This is a nice spot for a special occasion brunch or even drinks after work.
